intro: Diastema incisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct serrated edge, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Diastema incisum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
